Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ramon A
Reviews.Content: The first room didn't have enough natural light, it was like a cave. We ask for an upgrade and they took us to a beach-front bedroom. The first one, the sliding glass door lock was broken. Then we got a third room. It was nice but the sheets were old and not fitted, as you move they came out. And NOOOO HOTTT WATER!!!!!!! at all. And the towels felt like sand paper. No coffe maker on the bedroom and we have to make our own coffe at the lobby . They don't even have coffe. La primera habitacion que nos dieron no tenia suficiente luz natural, parecia una cueva. Solicitamos algo mejor y nos dieron una habitacion frente al mar pero la puerta de cristal no cerraba el seguro estaba roto. La tercera habitacion que nos dieron estaba bastante bien pero las sabanas no ajustaban y se salian segun te movias. Si quieres una cama bien dura ese es el lugar para conseguirla. No habia NAAADDDAAA DE AGUA CALIENTE. nos dijeron que dejaramos el agua correr pero tampoco salio caliente. Las toallas parecian lija eran bien duras. No tiene cafetera en las habitaciones y tuve que hacer mi propio cafe en el lobby ya que ni tan siquiera tenian cafe. Yo traje mi propio cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Joyuda, Cabo Rojo”
Reviews.Author: Humberto Q
Reviews.Content: If you want a budget friendly place to stay, this is the one. Right in front of a beautiful beach protected by a reef. Perfect for snorkeling or sun baths in the sand. A very nice pool to relax and have a drink. The food was good and the service was great. I've stayed in all the others hotels in the area and have to say this one is the best. Close to the best restaurants in the west side of the island. Minutes from marinas and golf courses. In 15 minutes you can get to famous beaches in the area or stay in the private one the hotel has to offer. I would recommended to everyone visiting the area. I'm already booked for next month.

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel in Cabo Rojo”
Reviews.Author: Millie F
Reviews.Content: I stay there the weekend of september 2-4, 2011 and was the worst place to stay. The rooms dirty the sheets worst than dirty. The food was ok.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Joyuda”
Reviews.Author: martagonz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel the weekend of July 29th. We were very dissapointed with the room, # 122, which was for a couple and with a king bed. It was very shabby. Dressers, paint and bathroom were in disrepair and poorly lit. The room was not inviting at all. In our 2nd day there we were resting and an employee knocked on our door asking us to remove our car from its parking place (we had parked on the spot with our room # on it) because his boss wanted to park her car there. My husband went to the front desk and inquired and went back to try to rest. Two hours later they knocked very hard again on our room door and told us to move our car. There were other parking spaces available by ours. We didn't get any rest there, they were very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family and friends to stay”
Reviews.Author: FernandoSierra
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the people that gave such bad reviews really stay at the hotel, but it was a good place for the price......If you want "much details" or "service details" like a luxurious hotel, go to other place in that range (but of course be ready to pay for it).......The employees were very kind, the food at the restaurant and menu (breakfast, lunch and dinner) were excellent. The beach area is small but adequate (there is even chance to snurkle and see marine life nearby)......the pool was also nice to relax.....Saturday night includes a DJ with Kareoke.....a lot of fun....! For us it was a nice vacation.......I will recommend the place to anyone.....

Reviews.Title: “Worst. Hotel. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Rickyrasta
Reviews.Content: Dirty, cockroaches everywhere, bed hard as rocks _can't stress enough how bad the bed is, worst bed I've ever "slept" in_, dirty sheets don't even cover the whole dirty mattress, so you end up "sleeping" on top of a plastic-covered dirty mattress, bad service, bad food...the whole nightmare package. Yes, listed to all the other reviews. This place is as bad as they come. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Not recomend”
Reviews.Author: paganga1
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but mattress and pillow are hard as a rocks. Roaches was found in the bath room. Thanks to Good I only spend one night.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: JJSony
Reviews.Content: This was a total waste of time and money. I definitely wouldâ€™ve looked for another place had I taken the time to check this review site before making my reservation. Basically, all negative comments that are being said on here by other guests are accurate to the very last detail. The one guy that gave very positive reviews mustâ€™ve been paid by the hotel to do so. The most mentioned negative comment Iâ€™ve seen on here â€“ the hard mattresses â€“ is very true. We first checked into one room but the hotel attendant offered us another room because we were having problems with a weak Internet connection, which only works in the front lobby and in the one room closest to the lobby. That first room â€“ close to the pool - had a king bed but it only had the hard box-spring over a wooden frame. The bed lacked the much softer mattress that goes on top needed for a pleasant night of sleep. The mattress also had dirty sheets and sperm-stained blankets, and it still had hair from the previous guests as if the sheets hadnâ€™t been replaced before our arrival. So we took the offer from the attendant and moved to the other room hoping not only for a better Internet signal but also for a smoother, cleaner bed. Well, I guess we were hoping for way too much. The bed was also filthy and stained; and the mattress was harder than concrete. A third room with two smaller beds that the attendant showed us was no different. That one even had roaches scrambling around over the beds. We had already paid for three days and two nights and the check-in agreement stipulates there is no refund for early departures so it wasnâ€™t like we had too many options other than stay put and make the best of it. The hotel attendant that night was very cordial (not her fault) and tried her best to help us but we cannot say the same about the raunchy-looking hotel owner. We saw him only a couple of times during our stay there but just judging by the rancid look in his face it is wiser to just stay away from there in the future. I hate having to come online to write this negative review but it absolute annoys me when I get fooled by deceiving advertising and false expectations. The Joyuda Beach Hotel is not worth a nightâ€™s stayâ€¦ not even for $60 bucks a night. Youâ€™d be better off staying at a cheap motel. At least youâ€™ll have a microwave! Also, it is true what others say on this board. The pool is very tiny - like for a couple at a time - and it is only 5â€™ deep. It was full of leaves and a disgusting bubbling foam as if it hadnâ€™t been cleaned in a long time; and it didnâ€™t even have lighting in the water for use at night so it was pitch black the night we arrived. The beach was very small and shared with guests from an old-looking apartment condo next door. The beach sand was also filled with rocks all over so you can only take a few steps into the water bare feet. No ice machine available, though. An old dirty red cooler with more water than ice was available. Donâ€™t get caught bringing in your own beer from outside or a cooler because it is in the rules â€“ btw, rules that you only learn after you pay - that you will get slapped with a $250 fine if you dare. And if you ask for an additional towel you will get another $150 fine. The â€œmotelâ€™s restaurantâ€� was about the size of a small paint cabin. We didnâ€™t even consider eating there. Thatâ€™s how pathetic it looked. One thing that sucked badly and that nobody mentions on this review site is that all room showers literally spray water all over the place except to the body of the person taking the shower. There was a similar problem with the bathroom sink. You have to open the valve very carefully because the water faucet has no meshing to control the flow and to distribute the stream evenly. Open it a little too much or too quickly and you wonâ€™t even need a shower. Stay away from this place, pitch in an extra 20 and find yourself another hotel. I, as a local Puerto Rican, DO NOT recommend this rat-stinking-hole to no tourists from abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation for price paid”
Reviews.Author: Maryracing
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews after reserving my stay of 3 days 2 nights, and was very worried. But as soon as I arrived to the Hotel I felt better about my desision, I found it very confortable even being small, and excellent for the price paid. Private beach just steps away, near many excellent restaurants, small swimming pool; excellent to relax and rest from daily life!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel From Hell”
Reviews.Author: TrooperPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Fraudulent announcement and photos.The mention beach is 75 feel long and you can not swim in it. Room stinks. mattress are hard as a rocks. Sheets are toast as piece of bread . Bathrooms are unsecured. old and broken furniture old as hell. This place look like a cheap Motel. It needs a major renovation to be called a "Hotel" The only good thing I found was the food. I don't think that a person in their right mind would comeback there. The owner is either a cheap skate or a lunatic.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Dirty a Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mandin12
Reviews.Content: Once we opened the door of the room start our nightmare, we stayed at a room with view which was even more expensive however, everything look so dirty, old, broken and ugly that we didn't even unpack. Everything look dirty, the odor was terrible, the bed was like sleeping on bricks, the pillows were so tall and hard that it was impossible to use. The towels, the blankets were dirty. I have nothing nice to say about this place, it is a complete disappointment, we just felt like they are stealing people's money. We ask for the manager several times, he was never available. We decided to leave before time, we could not stand one more night on that place. Don't go to this place, nobody takes responsibility for what is going on at that "hotel", we do not understand how they can be open, it is a shame for Puerto Rico tourism.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Mojito1953
Reviews.Content: This dump is located on a beautiful beach with sunsets over the carribean. But our experience was a nightmare. The check in was OK but as soon as we opened the door to the room, it smelled as if some dropped a gallon of bleach and never cleaned it up. It was impossible to breath. Our next room was better but the matress was like a slab of cement and the bedspread has urine stains. The king size bed had two full size sheets that overlapped and there was no hot water. The beachfront bar only played music from Santo Domingo and the corn fingers tasted like very old grease. If you are ever in Joyuda, stay away from this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Bad idea!”
Reviews.Author: Curlygirlm
Reviews.Content: I wish we had checked the reviews here before going to this place. We can only agree with all the bad reviews. The only positive was that the staff at the restaurant were friendly and the food was decent. Not sure about the drinks served in plastic Solo cups though. The bed in the room was so bad that we ended up leaving at 4 AM because we just couldn't stand laying in bed anymore. The mattress seemed to be made out of wood...my back still hurts two days later! Also the "beach" was a joke! Don't stay there! It ruined our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: jmz0529
Reviews.Content: The so-called beach was about 100 feet long., that was it...the mattress in Rm 118 were terrible...both beds were covered in vinyl and were so hard it would have been better to sleep on the floor. The bed spreads were dirty and stained. No wash cloths provided and none available when asked. Ice was kept in a cooler by the front desk...half melted. After a rain, the walk ways were flooded up to the outside doors of some of the rooms. You had to wear a paper wrist band the entire time you were there so they would know you were a quest at the hotel. We found this Hotel on the Internet and the pictures are very deceiving. The swimming pool was littered with leaves and very small. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Save your money and go to a Holiday Inn...

Reviews.Title: “Little beach hotel on seafood row”
Reviews.Author: IJK01
Reviews.Content: We checked into this small beach front hotel for one night and extended our stay, day by day, for three additional nights., each at $90 per. Staff and manager couldn't have been more helpful, they even let us use their front desk PC to view Trip Advisor to help plan our next stop in Ponce. When we were there in mid-January the place was almost empty but the snack bar/restaurant was open daily so we could grab coffee or whatever each morning. The hotel has a small, very secluded, private beach which is shared with the low rise condo next store. Room was large and clean but sparsely furnished. A nice get away from it all place during the slow winter season in these parts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the food, bed a little hard”
Reviews.Author: RichiePR77
Reviews.Content: We arrived and we have to make two check-in's, one at the hotel and one at the restaurant, because the offer includes all the foods, but it had to be paid directly on the restaurant. Bed was a little hard. We thought it was a box spring, but it was a hard-like-wood mattress. A/C was an individual unit and it worked OK, also the hot water. Room was clean, but cable TV was a basic one. When looked up at the cable company website, it wasn't even the digital basic one. The food at the restaurant was great, but we kind of get a little lost on the service. Sometimes we could sit at the table and the waiter would come and take our order, but in other times (mainly breakfast) we have to ask for it at the restaurant bar. Sometimes the beverages wouldn't come to the table, so we had to ask for them at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Items not returned”
Reviews.Author: sinamontwst02
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the room, but on our departure I realized that I had left my diamond ring, have called the hotel and talked with the lady that cleaned my room, she stated that she had found the ring and would give to management so that it would be mailed to Maryland, but as of this date I have not received my package. Several calls have been made and I keep getting the run around. The lady at the desk keeps telling my friend that no one in managment is around.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never consider this hotel if you want to have a good time or at least a friendly, respectable staff. I considered this hotel because of the information in the Frommers travel guide. I made a reservation for two days by phone and asked about the water and swimming conditions. They told me there was clean, clear water and that there were few waves and good snorkneling conditions. When we came there it was exactly the opposite. The water was not clean but dirty and muddy, there were lots of waves and stones sticking out of the water and near hotel there was a lot of garbage. We told them it's not what they told us about the hotel and it wasn't acceptable and we can't stay here. We asked to speak to manager, but he refused to meet us. As a result we idn't stay at this hotel and they charged our credit card 112$ because of their cancellation policy. Do not stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not the place!!”
Reviews.Author: akerl50544
Reviews.Content: we went to the joyuda beach resort 12/26/04 thru 12/29 04. we were not expecting anything great. we traveled p.r. for 10 days for the second time and once out of san juan your not really going to get fancy hotels. this hotel looked ok fom the outside. checked in at 11:00 a.m. the would not let us into the room until 4:00 even though there was hardly anyone there. no problem there were plenty of restaurants in the area to have lunch. we got into the hotel room. after a little examination the place is not really kept up. mold in the corners as well as all along the bottom of the tub, nevermind 6 or 7 guwee things on the bathroom door. still no problem, i was not expecting much. we got settled in and went to the hotel beach. there is about 20 ft of sand, total rocks as soon as you touch the water. no swimming! might not be a problem for some people but it is a non smoking hotel inside and out. we went out exploring, down to boquonron (cool little town) as well as the el faro (lighthouse) as well as a couple of cool beaches. came back to the hotel then went out for dinner in joyuda (ok). went to bed, to my surprise the king bed matress is wrapped in plastic and fitted with 2 sets of twin flat sheets which were wrapped around us in the morning with parts of our bodies on the plastic. still ok with it. went to get a shower, it pretty much dribbled out. i went to the desk to complain. she said she would take care of it. we took off for the afternoon, came back, still a dribble. complained again, said the maintenance person is no longer there, they will fix it in the morning. morning came and still no shower and then we left. i wasn't expecting to much but a shower that worked corectly is 1 of the most important, never mind the cleanliness and bed. simply we will never go back again even though we will be back to cabo rojo.

Reviews.Title: “The website looks much better than the real thing!”
Reviews.Author: katieling
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Joyuda Beach two weeks ago. We stayed at the Joyuda Beach hotel for 3 nights. Not very impressed by it. The hotel smells and I got bitten by something in bed and felt itchy the whole time. The room is very basic, worst than a DayÃ‚ s inn by American Standard. We had a king bed but they didn't have King bed sheet. So they put two full sheets together to make the bed. The beach is not a good siwmming beach. It has very shallow water about 2 feet the most. The beach is tiny and the sand is not fine. You can't go too far out since there is a breaker between the beach and the ocean. The reef just off the hotel is all dead and so you can't do snorkeling either. We ended up go to Boqueron for swimming and Gilligan's Island for snorkeling.The website photo looks much prettier than the real thing!We asked the staff where was a good place to eat, the only thing they would recommended was the hotel restaurant. In fact, there are plenty of best PR seafood restaurants nearby.The only good thing with the hotel is it is cheap. We only paid $65 including tax per week night. And it is close to all the good seafood restaurants and it is pretty convenient to all the attractions in west PR. If you do decide to stay there, call the hotel directly. You'll get better deal than through some hotel booking websites.
